verb.description: Pronounce words in a religious rite, to confer or invoke divine favor upon; ask God to look favorably on.
examples: he blessed the dying man and anointed him

phrases: the poor thing never stood a chance, bless her heart
I was just wondering why people say bless you when someone sneezes.
When someone tells me God Bless you when I sneeze, I feel a little more cared for.
origin: Old English blēdsian, blētsian, based on blōd blood (i.e. originally perhaps mark or consecrate with blood). The meaning was influenced by its being used to translate Latin benedicere to praise, worship, and later by association with bliss.
